answerText: azide[10] This phenomenon describes how the electrons in the azide bonds can move, changing the bonds from single to double, or double to triple, resulting in multiple possible structures. It is represented with a double sided arrow.
heading: DEES |2014 | Columbia B | 18 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In the Huisgen cycloaddition, this functional group reacts with a terminal alkyne to produce a 1, 2, 3-triazole.  [10] Name this functional group that consists of three nitrogen atoms, which can be denoted as two double bonds or a triple bond and a single bond between the three nitrogen atoms.
